Hildegard Franke, freshEHR Clinical Informatics Ltd.<hildi@freshehr.com>

details.purpose: Recording of the General Practitioner Assessment of Cognition (GPCOG) screening test. This test was designed as a GP screening tool for dementia. There are two components: a cognitive assessment conducted with the patient, and an informant questionnaire (only considered necessary if the results of the cognitive section are equivocal, i.e. score 5-8 inclusive). Results > 8 or < 5 on the GPCOG patient section were assumed to be cognitively intact or impaired, respectively For patients requiring a informant questionnaire, scores of 3 or less out of 6 in this section indicates cognitive impairment.
details.use: To record the results of the General Practitioner Assessment of Cognition (GPCOG) screening test.

items.items: The General Practitioner Assessment of Cognition (GPCOG) screening test.
A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Narrative record of factors that may have contributed to the score.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
Statement whether the patient gives a correct or incorrect answer when asked to give the exact date today.
The patient gives an incorrect answer.
The patient gives the correct answer.
Statement whether or not the patient marks all the correct numbers to indicate the hours of the clock with the correct spacing.
The patient does not mark all the correct numbers to indicate the hours of the clock with the correct spacing.
The patient marks all the correct number to indicate the hours of the clock with the correct spacing.
Statement whether the patient correctly marks in hands a specified time (i.e. 10 minutes past 11 o'clock) on a clock face.
The patient does not correctly mark in hands a specified time (11.10) on a clock face.
The patient correctly marks in hands a specified time (11.10) on a clock face.

Statement whether the patient gives a correct and specific answer when asked to say something that happened in the news recently. Recently = in the last week. If a general answer is given, e.g. "lot of rain", "war", further details should be asked for.
Patient does not give specific and correct answer when asked to say something that happened in the news recently.
Patient gives specific and correct answer when asked to say something that happened in the news recently.
Statement whether patient correctly recalls first name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient does not correctly recall first name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient correctly recalls first name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Statement whether patient correctly recalls surname of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient does not correctly recall surname of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient correctly recalls surname of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Statement whether patient correctly recalls house number of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient does not correctly recall house number of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient correctly recalls house number of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Statement whether patient correctly recalls street name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient does not correctly recall street name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient correctly recalls street name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Statement whether patient correctly recalls locality or town of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient does not correctly recall locality or town of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.
Patient correctly recalls locality or town of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.

The total score from all nine individual scores. If patient scores 9, no significant cognitive impairment and further testing not necessary. If patient scores 5-8, more information required. Proceed with Step 2, informant section. If patient scores 5-8, more information required. Proceed with Step 2, informant section.
Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient has more trouble remembering things that have happened recently than he/she used to.
Step 1 of the GPCOG screening test, relating to the patient examination.
Step 2 of the GPCOG screening test, relating to the informant interview. This section is required if the total score from Step 1 is between 5 and 8.
The patient has more trouble remembering things that have happened recently than he/she used to.
The patient does not have more trouble remembering things that have recently happened than he/she used to.
The informant doesn't know whether the patient has more trouble remembering thigns tha thave happened recently than he/she used to.
Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient has more trouble recalling conversations a few days later.
The patient has trouble recalling conversations a few days later.
The patient does not have trouble recalling conversations a few days later.
The informant doesn't know whether the patient has trouble recalling conversations a few days later.
Difficulty finding right words or using wrong words
Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient, when speaking, has more difficulty in finding the right words or tends to use the wrong words more often.
When speaking, the patient has difficulty in finding the right words or tends to use the wrong words more often.
When speaking, the patient does not have difficulty in finding the right words and does not tend to use the wrong words more often.
The informant doesn't know whether the patient, when speaking, has more difficulty in finding the right words or tends to use the wrong words more often.
Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient is less able to manage money and financial affairs (e.g. paying bills, budgeting).
The patient is less able to manage money and financial affairs.
The patient is not less able to manage money and financial affairs.
The informant doesn't know whether the patient is less able to manage money and financial affairs.
The question of whether the patient is less able to manage money or financial affairs is not applicable to this patient.
Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently.
The patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently.
The patient is not less able to manage his/her medication independently.
The informant doesn't know whether the patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently.
The question whether the patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently is not relevant to this patient.

Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient needs more assistance with transport (either private or public). If patient has difficulties only due to physical problems, e.g. bad leg, 'No' should be selected.
The patient needs more assistance with transport.
The patient does not need more assistance with transport.
The informant doesn't know whether the patient needs more assistance with transport.
The question whether the patient needs more assistance with transport is not applicable to this patient.
To get the total score, add the number of items answered 'No', 'Don't know' or 'Not applicable'. A total score of 0-3 indicates cognitive impairment, and standard investigations should be conducted.
